questions.uddipok: The following is the beginning of a story. Complete it in your own words. One day a bad man went to a Sadhu who had spiritual knowledge and asked him, "Where is God?"…………

sub_questions.explanation: The Bad Man and the Sadhu One day, a bad man went to Sadhu who had spiritual knowledge and asked him, "Where is God?" Hearing this, the Sadhu took up a lump of earth and flung it at the head of the questioner. The man went to the judge and complained against the Sadhu for having inflicted a severe pain in his head. The judge had arrested the Sadhu and brought up for trial. As the accused stood in the dock, the judge said, "Why, instead of answering the complainant's questions, did you throw a lump of earth at him?" The Sadhu replied, "The blow he received with the lump was an answer to his questions. He has told you that there is a pain in his head. Let him show me the pain, and I shall show him God." The judge was pleased with the Sadhu's defence and dismissed the case.

questions.uddipok: Write a letter to your friend 'Amio' telling him about the possible risks of selfie mania.

sub_questions.explanation:
PC Road, Tangail
10 May 2024
Dear Amio,
I hope you're well! Today, I'm going to talk about something important. Have you heard about the selfie mania?
A selfie is a picture that you take of yourself using a camera of a mobile phone. And when taking selfies become an addiction, it is called selfie mania. Selfies are fun. But there are some risks we should know about taking selfies. Sometimes, people take selfies in dangerous places. This can be really risky because they might get hurt. Also, some people become too focused on taking the perfect selfie and forget to pay attention to what's happening around them. They might walk into
things or even step out into the road without looking.
So, it's important to be careful while taking selfies. Anyway, tender my regards to your parents and love to the
youngers.
Yours ever,
Melina.

questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage.
Education aims to bring about positive changes in our behavior. It helps us try to change our lives as well as the society we live in. Education that does not illuminate our minds or does not inspire us to work for the community is not complete at all. Education is not all about getting grades or receiving certificates- we use education to make life better. We are expected to apply the knowledge, skills and values that we learn in a classroom in our engagement with the world that lies outside. And we can do so in many different ways. Let's have a look at how education works. Learners' civic engagement is highly appreciated all over the world. Civic engagement means working to make a difference in the civic life (the public life of the citizens as constructed with private or personal life) of the community using knowledge, skills, values and motivation. Civic engagement promotes the quality of life in a community by contributing to the improvement of health and wellbeing of the people.
Civically engaged individuals recognize themselves as members of a larger social community and are concerned about civic issues. They consider themselves responsible citizens who take action or raise their voices against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills.
In civic engagement, issues of public concern are crucial. Civic engagement includes individual or group activities to protect public interests and change the way the community values itself. For example, If you are protesting against any unjust decision of the local municipality such as raising taxes or an act that might work against people's interests, you are civically engaged and your action is considered a civic engagement. This protest can be done in different ways such as organizing rallies, collecting signatures, making human chains, writing petitions, etc. You can also help control traffic in front of a school, help children to cross the roads, work in a team to clean a park or a sea beach. You can also give some services to elderly people. These are all examples of civic engagement as what you do directly affects the community.
When civic engagement is a part of an academic program, and the learners' engagement is assessed following a scale, then it is called service learning. It involves the application of knowledge and skills learned in the classroom and then making a complete plan of action 1.e. preparing a budget, starting the process of implementation, involving people and activating operational strategies.

sub_questions.explanation: Education plays a vital role in bringing about positive changes in behaviour. It helps us try to change our life as well as our society. Complete education not only illuminates our minds but also inspires us to work for the community. The purpose of education is not getting grades and receiving certificates. The main objective of education is to make life better. Civic engagement of the learners is highly appreciated all over the world nowadays. A civically engaged person works to create a difference in the civic life taking action or raising voice against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills. When we work for social welfare, we are civically engaged. Civic engagement may be individual or group activities. For example, we can raise voice against raising excessive taxes. This protest can be done by organising ralles, collecting signature, making human chains, etc. Learners engagement is evaluated by following a scale. Rnowledge and skills learned in the school is applied. in society for public welfare.

questions.uddipok:
Read the following text and make a flow-chart showing some features of the Chinese culture regarding
dining, gift and greeting. (One is done for you)
Dining: Sit where you are instructed to sit. Be graceful and polite when taking food with chopsticks. Don't make much noise when eating or drinking soup. Don't play with chopsticks or point at anyone with them.
Gift: Do present and receive things with both hands. Politely refusing a gift before accepting it is the norm in Chinese culture, so don't be discouraged when someone initially refuses your gift. White flowers are not good as they symbolize death. Greetings: Shake hands softly as a firm handshake could be considered a sign of aggression. It may make your Chinese friends feel uncomfortable. Greet the most senior first and gradually others. Children are expected to greet you rather than you greeting the children.
1. Sitting where instructed while having dinner→ 2 → 3 → 4 → 5 → 6

questions.uddipok:
Write down the summary of the following poem:-
Hold fast to dreams
For if dreams die
Life is a broken-winged bird
That cannot fly.
Hold fast to dreams
For when dreams go
Life is a barren field
Frozen with snow.

sub_questions.explanation: The poem underscores the importance of holding or fostering a dream since life without dream is meaningless and it loses its true purpose. The poet compares such dreamless life with a 'broken-winged bird', which is unable to fly to reach its destination. In addition, the poet compares a life void of dream with a 'barren field' which is covered with frozen snow. Indeed, we must cherish a dream to be súccessful in life.

questions.uddipok:
Rearrange the following sentences to make a coherent order.
(i) Next day all the servants submitted their sticks to the judge.
(ii) The judge also said that the stick of the thief would increase by an inch.
(iii) One stick was found shortened by an inch and the thief was easily detected and sent to jail thereby.
(iv) He made a complaint before the judge.
(v) He gave all of them a stick of equal length and asked to submit the stick on the following day.
(vi) He thought that the purse had been stolen by someone of his servants.
(vii) The judge summoned all the servants and all of them denied the charge.
(viii) One day a rich man lost his purse.
(ix) The judge then hit upon a plan to detect the thief.
(x) The servants went home and everyone kept his stick as it was but the servant who stole the purse reduced the length of his stick by one inch.

sub_questions.explanation:
(viii) →(vi)→ (iv) → (vii) → (ix)→ (v)→(ii)→(x) → (i) → (iii).
One day a rich man lost his purse. He thought that the purse had been stolen by someone of his servants. He made a complaint before the judge. The judge summoned all the servants and all of them denied the charge. The judge then hit upon a plan to detect the thief. He gave all of them a stick of equal length and asked to submit the stick on the following day. The judge also said that the stick of the thief would increase by an inch. The servants went home and everyone kept his stick as it was but the servant who stole the purse reduced the length length of his stick by one inch. Next day all the servants submitted their sticks to the judge. One stick was found shortened by an inch and the thief was easily detected and sent to jail thereby.
